meanings.definition: A device for reproducing sound using a stylus to trace vibrations on a grooved disc.
meanings.sent1: My grandparents used phonographs to listen to music.
meanings.sent2: The antique shop had a collection of phonographs for sale.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the phonographs, causing a funny jumble of sounds.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like a chorus of phonographs.
meanings.sent5: The phonographs played a melody that brought back memories of childhood.

meanings.sent1: At the party, the DJ set up multiple phonographs to keep the music going.
meanings.sent2: She gently placed the needle on the phonographs to start the song.
meanings.sent3: The phonographs seemed to dance as the music played.
meanings.sent4: His heart skipped a beat when he heard the familiar crackle of the phonographs.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with the warm sound of the phonographs.

meanings.sent1: I will phonograph our conversation so we can listen to it later.
meanings.sent2: She loves to phonograph her favorite songs to enjoy them anytime.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally phonographed over his sister's favorite recording.
meanings.sent4: The artist's voice was phonographed onto the vinyl with great care.
meanings.sent5: They decided to phonograph their voices as a special gift for their parents.
